Detailed Description
The Ingame Control Panel basically controls the WorldGenerator.
It is only interactable for the current MasterClient in the room.

void Photon.Pun.Demo.Procedural.IngameControlPanel.Awake ( )
When the object gets created, all necessary references are set up.
Also the UI elements get set up properly in order to control the WorldGenerator.

override void Photon.Pun.Demo.Procedural.IngameControlPanel.OnJoinedRoom ( )[virtual]
Gets called when the local client has joined the room.
Since only the MasterClient can control the WorldGenerator, we are checking if we have to make the UI controls available for the local client.

override void Photon.Pun.Demo.Procedural.IngameControlPanel.OnMasterClientSwitched (Player newMasterClient)[virtual]
Gets called whenever the current MasterClient has left the room and a new one is selected.
If the local client is the new MasterClient, we make the UI controls available for him.

OnRoomPropertiesUpdate() OnRoomPropertiesUpdatePhoton.Pun.Demo.Procedural.IngameControlPanel Photon.Pun.Demo.Procedural.IngameControlPanelOnRoomPropertiesUpdate
override void Photon.Pun.Demo.Procedural.IngameControlPanel.OnRoomPropertiesUpdate (Hashtable propertiesThatChanged)[virtual]
Gets called whenever the Custom Room Properties are updated.
In this callback we are interested in the settings the MasterClient can apply to the WorldGenerator. If all possible settings are updated (and available within the updated properties), these settings are also used to update the Ingame Control Panel as well as the WorldGenerator on all clients. Afterwards the WorldGenerator creates a new world with the new settings.
Reimplemented from Photon.Pun.MonoBehaviourPunCallbacks.
